0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Candidiasis of skin, Due to Candida albicans: TOPICAL, massage cream, lotion, or suspension into affected skin twice daily
  • Tinea, Tinea pedis, tinea cruris, tinea corporis, tinea versicolor: TOPICAL, massage cream, lotion, or suspension into affected skin twice daily

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and efficacy not demonstrated in children less than 10 years old
  • Candidiasis of skin, Due to Candida albicans: TOPICAL (10 y and older) massage cream, lotion, or suspension into affected skin twice daily
  • Tinea, Tinea pedis, tinea cruris, tinea corporis, tinea versicolor: TOPICAL (10 y and older) massage cream, lotion, or suspension into affected skin twice daily

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Candidiasis of skin, Due to Candida albicans
  • Tinea, Tinea pedis, tinea cruris, tinea corporis, tinea versicolor

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Ciclopirox: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Ciclopirox olamine, a fungicidal agent, inhibits the growth of a wide variety of pathogenic fungi.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • gently massage cream or lotion into affected areas and surrounding skin twice a day (morning and evening)
  • avoid use of occlusive dressing

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• resolution or improvement of clinical signs and symptoms
  • increased irritation, erythema, itching, burning, blistering, swelling, or oozing at application site
  • no improvement in or worsening of symptoms

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patients to report increased irritation, erythema, itching, burning, blistering, swelling, or oozing at application site.
  • Instruct patients to avoid use of occlusive dressings.
  • Patient should not use nail polish or false-nails if using drug to treat fingernails or toenails.
